fileStructureSection.fileStructure:
**Functional Purpose**: Section header for file structure settings
**UI Location**: Settings → GitHub Syncer → Connected section → File structure
**When Users See This**: When viewing the GitHub Syncer settings for a connected repository
**Technical Context**: N/A
**Current English**: "File structure"
fileStructureSection.configureFolderStru:
**Functional Purpose**: Explains the purpose of the file structure configuration
**UI Location**: Settings → GitHub Syncer → Connected section → File structure
**When Users See This**: When viewing the GitHub Syncer settings for a connected repository
**Technical Context**: N/A
**Current English**: "Use this option to configure the folder structure for your repository."
fileStructureSection.placeholderValues:
**Functional Purpose**: Introduces the list of available placeholder values for the path template
**UI Location**: Settings → GitHub Syncer → Connected section → File structure
**When Users See This**: When viewing the GitHub Syncer settings for a connected repository
**Technical Context**: N/A
**Current English**: "You can use the following placeholder values, which will be interpolated for each commit:"
fileStructureSection.pathTemplateMustInc:
**Functional Purpose**: Error message indicating invalid path template requirements
**UI Location**: Settings → GitHub Syncer → Connected section → File structure (below input field)
**When Users See This**: When the user enters an invalid path template that does not contain the required placeholders
**Technical Context**: Refers to placeholders `code: $track_slug`, `code: $track_title`, `code: $exercise_slug`, `code: $exercise_title` which must remain unchanged.
**Current English**: "Your path template must include either `code: $track_slug` or `code: $track_title`, and either `code: $exercise_slug` or `code: $exercise_title`."
fileStructureSection.saveChanges:
**Functional Purpose**: Button label to save the changes to the path template
**UI Location**: Settings → GitHub Syncer → Connected section → File structure
**When Users See This**: After making changes to the path template
**Technical Context**: N/A
**Current English**: "Save changes"
fileStructureSection.revertToDefault:
**Functional Purpose**: Button label to revert the path template to its default value
**UI Location**: Settings → GitHub Syncer → Connected section → File structure
**When Users See This**: When the path template has been modified from its default value
**Technical Context**: N/A
**Current English**: "Revert to default"
fileStructureSection.areYouSureWantRever:
**Functional Purpose**: Title for the confirmation modal when reverting path template
**UI Location**: Settings → GitHub Syncer → Connected section → File structure (confirmation modal)
**When Users See This**: When the user clicks the 'Revert to default' button
**Technical Context**: N/A
**Current English**: "Are you sure you want to revert your path template to default?"
fileStructureSection.revert:
**Functional Purpose**: Label for the confirmation button in the revert path template modal
**UI Location**: Settings → GitHub Syncer → Connected section → File structure (confirmation modal)
**When Users See This**: Within the confirmation modal for reverting path template
**Technical Context**: N/A
**Current English**: "Revert"
fileStructureSection.cancel:
**Functional Purpose**: Label for the decline/cancel button in the revert path template modal
**UI Location**: Settings → GitHub Syncer → Connected section → File structure (confirmation modal)
**When Users See This**: Within the confirmation modal for reverting path template
**Technical Context**: N/A
**Current English**: "Cancel"
